Key Match Events: Tobias Harris delivered a double-double performance with 24 points and 10 rebounds.
Cade Cunningham contributed 18 points for the Pistons.
Malik Beasley added 12 points off the bench.
Tim Hardaway Jr. chipped in with 11 points.
Jalen Duren provided a solid presence in the paint, adding 10 points and 14 rebounds.
Miles Bridges led the Hornets with 20 points, nine rebounds, and five assists.
Mark Williams contributed 18 points and nine rebounds for the Hornets.
The Hornets held a narrow 47-46 lead at halftime.
Charlotte finished the second quarter with an 18-6 run, sparked by Seth Curry's three-point play and capped by Miles Bridges' 31-foot 3-pointer at the buzzer.
Post-Match Reflections: The Detroit Pistons secured a 98-94 victory over the Charlotte Hornets.
The win marks Detroit's fifth victory in their last six games.
The Pistons showcased a strong team effort despite the absence of starting guard Jaden Ivey, who is sidelined with a fractured left fibula.
The Hornets have been struggling with a nine-game losing streak and 17 losses in their last 18 games.
Despite the late surge from Charlotte, the Pistons maintained their composure in the second half to seal the victory.
With this win, Detroit continues to show resilience in the absence of key players and keeps their momentum going as they push forward in the NBA season.
